comments.body: I'd prefer the examples be more cluster-type independent. Not everyone are using minikube so for those users these examples won't be of much help.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +51,55 @@	Specifying a attribute name that already exists will merge new fields on top of existing values.`)

	setExample = templates.Examples(`
	# Set server field on the my-cluster cluster to https://1.2.3.4
	kubectl config set clusters.my-cluster.server https://1.2.3.4

comments.body:
> Map keys may not contain dots

Is this checked somewhere?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@		Long: `Sets an individual value in a .kubeconfig file

		property-name is a dot delimitted name where each token represents either a attribute name or a map key.  Map keys may not contain dots.
		property-value is the new value you wish to set.
